components.content:
<>
Infinity
UQL JSON CSV XML Authentication Install

Grafana Infinity Datasource

Data from your own API

Connect public / private / authenticated endpoints.

Install
Try yourself

Features

Visualize data from JSON, CSV, XML, GraphQL, HTML & REST APIs.

UQL

Use powerful UQL query type to visualize data from JSON, CSV, XML. Leverage the power of UQL functions to transform the data the way you want.
Less worry about your data format. Use when your result format is not an flat array or if you require any transformations.

JSON

Connect various JSON APIs. Simple to use. No query languages to learn. Absolutely for newbies. Try inline your sample data before connecting to the real data.
For complex data formats, leverage the power of UQL's parse-json to structure your data.

CSV

Connect CSV, TSV or any delimited values. For complex data formats, leverage the power of UQL's parse-csv to structure your data.

XML

Visualize data from legacy XML rest/soap APIs. For complex data formats, leverage the power of UQL's parse-xml to structure your data.

Authentication

Connect to your APIs even if they require authentication. Supports Basic Authentication, API keys, Headers, Digest Auth, Forward OAuth, Oauth Client credentials and Oauth jwt formats
;

options.content:
JSON


Edit the next panel to see it in action and learn more.

JSON + UQL


parse-json

Edit the next panel to see it in action and learn more.

Sample CSV


iata,name,city,state,country,latitude,longitude
00M,Thigpen,Bay Springs,MS,USA,31.95376472,-89.23450472
00R,Livingston Municipal,Livingston,TX,USA,30.68586111,-95.01792778
00V,Meadow Lake,Colorado Springs,CO,USA,38.94574889,-104.5698933
01G,Perry-Warsaw,Perry,NY,USA,42.74134667,-78.05208056
01J,Hilliard Airpark,Hilliard,FL,USA,30.6880125,-81.90594389
01M,Tishomingo County,Belmont,MS,USA,34.49166667,-88.20111111
02A,Gragg-Wade,Clanton,AL,USA,32.85048667,-86.61145333
.....

CSV + UQL


parse-csv
| summarize count() by "state"

Edit the next panel to see it in action and learn more.

Sample XML

      5.95

      Fantasy

      Creepy Crawlies

      4.95
      2000-12-06

      Paradox Lost
      Science Fiction
      6.95
      2000-11-02
      After an inadvertant trip through a Heisenberg

      O'Brien, Tim
      Microsoft .NET: The Programming Bible
      Computer
      36.95
      2000-12-09
      Microsoft's .NET initiative is explored in 
      detail in this deep programmer's reference.
   
   
      O'Brien, Tim
      MSXML3: A Comprehensive Guide
      Computer
      36.95
      2000-12-01
      The Microsoft MSXML3 parser is covered in 
      detail, with attention to XML DOM interfaces, XSLT processing,

      Galos, Mike
      Visual Studio 7: A Comprehensive Guide
      Computer
      49.95
      2001-04-16
      Microsoft Visual Studio 7 is explored in depth,
      looking at how Visual Basic, Visual C++, C#, and ASP+ are 
      integrated into a comprehensive development 
      environment.

XML + UQL


parse-xml
| scope "catalog.book"
| summarize mean("price") by "genre"

Edit the next panel to see it in action and learn more.

options.content:
Sample Timeseries JSON


Live data from thingspeak feed 

{
  "channel": {
    "id": 38629,
    "name": "Traffic Monitor",
    "description": "Traffic Monitor showing density of cars detected",
    "latitude": "42.28",
    "longitude": "-71.35",
    "field1": "Density of Westbound Cars",
    "field2": "Density of Eastbound Cars",
    "created_at": "2015-05-19T20:14:03Z",
    "updated_at": "2019-07-24T20:12:00Z",
    "last_entry_id": 12908444
  },
  "feeds": [
    {
      "created_at": "2022-05-20T23:28:37Z",
      "entry_id": 12908345,
      "field1": "30.000000",
      "field2": "33.000000"
    },
    {
      "created_at": "2022-05-20T23:28:52Z",
      "entry_id": 12908346,
      "field1": "30.000000",
      "field2": "29.000000"
    }
  ]
}

Sample Timeseries from JSON


parse-json
| scope "feeds"
| project "ts"=todatetime("created_at"),"Density of Westbound Cars"=tonumber("field1"),"Density of Eastbound Cars"=tonumber("field2")
| order by "ts" asc

Edit the next panel to see it in action and learn more.

targets.uql:
parse-json
| scope "feeds"
| project "ts"=todatetime("created_at"),"Density of Westbound Cars"=tonumber("field1"),"Density of Eastbound Cars"=tonumber("field2")
| order by "ts" asc

options.content:

parse-csv
| project "ts"=todatetime("created_at"),"Density of Westbound Cars"=tonumber("field1"),"Density of Eastbound Cars"=tonumber("field2")
| order by "ts" asc

Edit the next panel to see it in action and learn more.

options.content:
Advanced UQL


{
        "totalCount": 3,
        "nextPageKey": "null",
        "resolution": "1h",
        "warnings": [
          "The contains filter transformation is deprecated and will be removed in a future release."
        ],
        "result": [
          {
            "metricId": "builtin:host.disk.avail",
            "dataPointCountRatio": "0.1211",
            "dimensionCountRatio": "0.0322",
            "data": [
              {
                "dimensions": [
                  "HOST-F1266E1D0AAC2C3C",
                  "DISK-F1266E1D0AAC2C3F"
                ],
                "timestamps": [
                  3151435100000,
                  3151438700000,
                  3151442300000
                ],
                "values": [
                  11.1,
                  22.2,
                  33.3
                ]
              },
              {
                "dimensions": [
                  "HOST-F1266E1D0AAC2C3C",
                  "DISK-F1266E1D0AAC2C3D"
                ],
                "timestamps": [
                  3151435100000,
                  3151438700000,
                  3151442300000
                ],
                "values": [
                  111.1,
                  222.2,
                  333.3
                ]
              }
            ]
          },
          {
            "metricId": "builtin:host.cpu.idle",
            "data": [
              {
                "dimensions": [
                  "HOST-F1266E1D0AAC2C3C"
                ],
                "timestamps": [
                  3151435100000,
                  3151438700000,
                  3151442300000
                ],
                "values": [
                  1.1,
                  2.2,
                  3.3
                ]
              }
            ]
          }
        ]
      }

Advanced UQL


parse-json
| scope "result"
| project-away "dataPointCountRatio", "dimensionCountRatio"
| mv-expand "data"
| project "dimensions"=array_to_map("data.dimensions",'host','disk'), "series"=array_from_entries('timestamp',"data.timestamps",'value',"data.values"), "metricId"
| project "host"="dimensions.host", "disk"="dimensions.disk", "series", "metricId"
| mv-expand "series"
| project "timestamp"="series.timestamp", "value"="series.value", "host", "disk", "metricId"
| extend "timestamp"=unixtime_milliseconds_todatetime("timestamp")
| order by "timestamp" asc
| jsonata "*[metricId != 'builtin:host.cpu.idle']"

Edit the next panel to see it in action and learn more.

targets.uql:
parse-json
| scope "result"
| project-away "dataPointCountRatio", "dimensionCountRatio"
| mv-expand "data"
| project "dimensions"=array_to_map("data.dimensions",'host','disk'), "series"=array_from_entries('timestamp',"data.timestamps",'value',"data.values"), "metricId"
| project "host"="dimensions.host", "disk"="dimensions.disk", "series", "metricId"
| mv-expand "series"
| project "timestamp"="series.timestamp", "value"="series.value", "host", "disk", "metricId"
| extend "timestamp"=unixtime_milliseconds_todatetime("timestamp")
| order by "timestamp" asc
| jsonata "*[metricId != 'builtin:host.cpu.idle']"
